node.title: 'Lay-by baby' service offers private health in instalments for expectant mums
node.alt: Adelaide mum Alicia Formosa with four-month-old Jett.
node.description: An Adelaide hospital is now giving parents like Alicia the chance to effectively lay-by their baby — paying off their medical care in fortnightly instalments.
node.content:
["Pregnancy comes with many questions\u00a0and whether to go public or private\u00a0is often one of them.", "Health insurance waiting periods mean delivering a baby in a private hospital is not an option for some expectant parents.", "But one Adelaide hospital is now giving parents the chance to effectively lay-by their baby \u2014\u00a0paying off their medical care in instalments.", "Four-month-old Jett Formosa was born in a private hospital, but the journey in getting there took some unusual turns for his parents.", "\"We already had private health but only extras, so we looked at adding on maternity cover but it's 12 months until you can use it,\" his mother Alicia Formosa\u00a0said.", "\"We were in the midst of getting it ready and then we fell pregnant so quickly, which was a blessing.\"", "", "
Jett is now four months old.(ABC News: Natasha Thiele)
", "With no maternity cover, Ms Formosa turned to a new service at the North Eastern Community Hospital, allowing her to pre-pay her hospital bills over time.", "\"It covered all of my visits, the hospital stay which included either a natural delivery or a C-section delivery,\" she said.", "\"We paid fortnightly \u2026 [so we were] paid in full by 36 weeks.", "Obstetrician\u00a0Chris Hughes helped develop the \"lay-by baby\"\u00a0model.", "\"Uninsured patients accessing private hospitals has been around for a long time, but I think it's the first time it's been presented as a pre-payment option,\" Dr Hughes said.", "\"When they've got that one-on-one relationship with their carer, it's easier to achieve that level of negotiation about timing of caesareans, potentially induction.\"", "", "
Chris Hughes is an obstetrician\u00a0at the North Eastern Community Hospital.(ABC News: Natasha Thiele)
", "Patients pay the roughly $9,000 bill in instalments, from 12 weeks into their pregnancy until a month before their due date.", "But the service may not be suited to everyone.", "\"They might have medical complications or there might be pregnancy complications that need that high level of care that's provided at either high-level maternity services in bigger places or at a big public hospital,\" Dr Hughes said.", "", "
Natasha Ramsay with her baby son Charlie.(ABC News: Natasha Thiele)
", "Natasha Ramsay also hoped to go private, but in the end chose to have her son Charlie in the public system at the Lyell McEwin Hospital.", "\"I could either pay outright with private or just choose one of the local public hospitals,\" she said.", "\"I went public because I had really good feedback from friends and family.", "\"The Lyell Mack in particular has a very good birthing suite.\"", "", "
Ms Ramsay said expectant mums often found themselves under pressure to make decisions early.
", "While Ms Ramsay had a smooth-sailing pregnancy, she said there was a lot of pressure to make decisions early.", "\"Normally at your first GP appointment, they're already asking which way you want to go, and so you kind of have to make a decision fairly quickly,\" she said.", "That challenge is one Ms Formosa can relate to.", "\"All of a sudden you find out you're pregnant and it's amazing \u2014 and then you're not really sure\u00a0which avenue to take,\" she said.", "\"At first, we looked at the public system, and then this opportunity came up.", "\"It's just a personal preference.\""]
